components.description:
A poodle, a popular dog breed with curly hair, often groomed in an ornamental pattern.

Generally depicted as a grayish-white poodle in full profile on all fours facing left, with a shaved torso, legs, and face with fuller, pom-pom-like hair on its head, ears, chest, feet, and tip of tail (as the Continental Clip).

Like üêï Dog, may be used to represent a variety of dog breeds (often fluffy or long-haired). See also üê∂ Dog Face.

Google, Samsung, and Facebook’s designs previously featured pink poodles.
components.title: Poodle

description:
A poodle, a popular dog breed with curly hair, often groomed in an ornamental pattern.

Generally depicted as a grayish-white poodle in full profile on all fours facing left, with a shaved torso, legs, and face with fuller, pom-pom-like hair on its head, ears, chest, feet, and tip of tail (as the Continental Clip).

Like üêï Dog, may be used to represent a variety of dog breeds (often fluffy or long-haired). See also üê∂ Dog Face.

title: Poodle

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A poodle is a breed of dog, commonly seen groomed with¬†longer hair around the head, paws and tail than the rest of the body. Poodle was appr http://emojipedia.org/poodle/
emoji_net_data.name: poodle

bn:00083126v: To produce a loud, short, explosive sound similar to that of a dog.
To make a short, loud, explosive noise with the vocal organs (said of animals, especially dogs).

bn:00063533n: The poodle is a group of formal dog breeds, the Standard Poodle, Miniature Poodle and Toy Poodle, with many coat colors.
An intelligent dog with a heavy curly solid-colored coat that is usually clipped; an old breed sometimes trained as sporting dogs or as performing dogs
Any of various breeds of dog.
A French breed of dog with curly hair.
Any of various breeds of dog originating in Europe as hunting dogs, and having heavy, curly fur in a solid color; their shoulder height indicates their classification as standard, miniature, or toy.

bn:00015267n: The domestic dog is a canid that is known as man's best friend.
The dog is a mammal in the order Carnivora.
A common four-legged animal, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things.
Subspecies of the Canid√¶ family, frequently kept as a pet
A member of the genus Canis (probably descended from the common wolf) that has been domesticated by man since prehistoric times; occurs in many breeds
The quality of being a dog.

bn:00061787n: Animal kept for companionship and a person's enjoyment

A pet is an animal kept primarily for a person's company or protection, as opposed to working animals, sport animals, livestock, and laboratory animals, which are kept primarily for performance, agricultural value, or research.
An animal which is kept in the home as a companion and treated affectionately.
An animal kept as a companion.
A domesticated animal kept for companionship or amusement
